comments.commentBody:
Unemployment down to 5.6%
Dow 17000
No troops in Iraq,
....

sure, all is bad

"the money you liberal Democrats have been taking from me!" - Incredible! Do you realize the irony there - you're buying into the message that big money has paid for. Our Congress (Dem and GoP) is largely bought and paid for. If you think either one cares about you, you're mistaken.
When the tallying is done, it will turn out that the Democrats and their friends spent more than the Republicans.

Two major reasons for Democrat losses:

1. Too little leadership from Obama
2. Too much big money for Republicans
Amen.
@Wine Country Dude, 42% approval rating is not the same as 48% willing to vote for the other guy. The extremely low approval ratings of Congress - and yet most re-elected - are proof of this.

How much would you be paying without recourse to healthcare  insurance? $12,000 a day in a hospital on average, I think. I am not aware of any taxes being raised to give all people healthcare who need it. But in light of your moniker, it is not surprising you feel no responsibility to your millions of fellow Americans who did not have health care before the ACA and you do not seem to understand how insurance works. Every insurance. Eben the one for your Bentley

@Grove
That is why I voted...hoping to get the Republican run Government I want and deserve!

As DemocracyNow pointed out last night ( http://democracynow.org ) even in supposedly Republican states like Arkansas and Alaska, voters overwhelmingly voted to increase the minimum wage. Yet no neoliberals took up this issue or economic justice. The polls on terrorism show how stupid it was for Obama with support from many neoliberals to start another War in Iraq and Syria. This just brought attention to the Wars and if you are going to War why not support true Warmongers like the Republicans? Personally I could not vote for Cory Booker after he supported the War instead I voted for Jeff Boss. Mu daughter voted for Howie Hawkins. The Democrats strategy for the next 2 years should be summed up in 2 words : filibuster and veto. But wait and see how quickly the Republican lying hypocrites get rid of the filibuster if the Democrats use it.
In the age of Peak Oil & Climate Change and plutocratic hegemony we are in a period of major political realignment. Just as in the 1850's, there will be a major change in the existing 2 Corporate Party system as populists from both left and right emerge.
Obama will be remembered as a President on the order of Millard Fillmore and his government as parallel to the Weimar Republic. As Ralph Nader has said for years, both right and left populists agree on ending the Wars, spying, Corporate Welfare, offshoring jobs, Internet freedoms. As with the Abolitionists, change is going to come from the grassroots then percolate up...

So your "solution" is to move the Dems even further to the left? Is your middle name Pyrrhus? I suppose your prescription is for Warren to be the Dem nominee in 2016.

The administration dropped the ball too many times to counter with aggression.

I want to say something about the email blasts. I think they were a terrible miscalculation. I found the unbelievable barrage of Democratic Party emails in the run-up to the election infuriating. This was not canny use of media; it was an alienating blast of spam. I always vote, but I'd be willing to bet real money that those emails aggravated a significant number of less-dedicated voters enough to make them stay home.

Last night's comments seemed to be overwhelmingly devoted to blaming Mr. Obama for the election results and here Rima is blaming the Democratic Party. I agree with some of the criticisms including Rima's criticism of the Democratic Party. However, the blame for the resurgence of the knee-jerk nihilist party belongs with the folks who voted for the Republicans solely to spite the Democrats and much more so with those who didn't vote at all. The American people have always been the proper target for blame for what goes on in this country.

You can't win without a message. You can't win when you're not true to your roots. You cannot win when you've veered so far astray from your constituency. You cannot win when you're bleeding voters to voter ID laws. A party with no soul cannot inspire its base.

Democrats did not go on any offensives since the start of 2014.
Democrats didn't make an issue of the VRA. Sure, they did for about five minutes, but they didn't present a united front and continue to stay on message.
The Democrats totally dropped the ball with the Ryan-Murray budget agreement, and agreeing to more sequester cuts before that.
Other than email blasts by the hundreds, where were Democrats this election season?
Shunning the president in favor of some future presumptive nominee who, herself, was passed over for him, has proven to be a failure as a strategy. None of the Democrats who ran with the help of the Neoliberal wing of the party won their races. Those would be Lundergan-Grimes, Nunn, Carter, just to name a few.

There are too many neoliberals in the Democratic party. Now is the time for a few of the old neoliberal guard to announce they won't be running for reelection in 2016. Let them graciously make way for new progressives to prepare for what promises to be a huge fight in two years.

The current leadership of the party at headquarters, the governors' association, and in Congress should all resign tonight. Let the Progressives take over. They are the soul of the party.

It isn't just concern for local trumping national concerns. This also ignores local concerns.

Jobs for Kentucky now? What about the kids in Kentucky, their jobs and their lives. People in Kentucky care about their kids and grandkids too. What about them?

The blindness is not local vs national. Local needs a future too. It is a blindness to anything but the most immediate profit for those who have money to donate.

I first heard them when I drove to Saturday morning class in the 80s. I realized early on I just loved the way they made each other laugh. It was so genuine. It reminded me of an interview Johnny Cash gave once where he explained that family voices working together, what he called 'blood on blood', could have a special, magical quality. There are several reasons why I'll still happily listen to the reruns:
1. My siblings have never been able to laugh about absurd things from our childhood--they take themselves too seriously. I love that these two could tease each other so good-naturedly for so many years.
2. While there is much I like on NPR, there is a 'public radio voice' that can be flat and affected, (what I call This American White) and completely grating. These two never talked that way. Their voices were full of life and spontaneity and their laughs were completely contagious. More regional accents!!
3. A favorite show I heard once involved a contest they ran for kids who felt they got stuck listening to the show in their parents' car on Saturday to call in and explain why they hated Car Talk.
4. Early on their respect for Volvos convinced me to buy a used 89 wagon. I adored that car and planned to keep it going indefinitely. We were nearing 300,000 miles on it when someone T-boned me on the highway. It saved my life to be in that car.
So you are a republican and you vote for republicans but you've had it with republicans.  Wow.

It is now time to accelerate income inequality, dismantle social security and medicare and give taxbreaks to the rich, while allowing religion to intrude on the lives of unbelievers.   All hail the koch brothers and their ilk.
Yup, just like the politicians.
exactly.  now that we've suffered through the 6-year republican temper tantrum, we can let the democrats see what kind of fit they wish to throw.  net-net  - more gridlock, dead ahead!

"The message instead is to get together and get things done for the country."

Good luck trying to sell that line.
Yes, money influenced my vote -- the money you liberal Democrats have been taking from me!
Really?  Was it so bad when wages were high and we had manufacturing jobs.  What exactly do you do with the poor, unemployed and uninsured?  Stick them on a train to where exactly?
We are going to get what they deserve, what they bought and paid for.
You take an awful lot for granted.  It's called voting and it happened already so that WAS the choice.
At least this money spent was good for the economy
People didn't vote Republican.  They voted anti Obama.  The egregious thing is that they spent over a billion to win and where did the money come from.  There is no vox populi.
Now lead, Mitch. I won't hold my breath.

If by "analytical" you mean devoid of logic, by "professional" you mean willingness to betray any shred of integrity for ratings, profit, and political manipulation, and by "intellectual" you mean the abandonment of reason, facts, and evidence...then yes, I fully agree. By those definitions, FOX truly is the embodiment of "journalism."

Doing the right thing is harder.

It's human nature.

Amazing! The US electorate proves yet again that they make voting choices that they know will hurt them. When GW Bush "won" his second term, the reactions pretty much anywhere around the world were predominantly of shock as people wondered how we could hand power back to someone who was clearly a poor choice, a tool in the hands of not-too-hidden interests. A UK tabloid summed it up in a headline: "How Can 59 Million People Be So Dumb?" Well, we've done it again.

GWB's second term led to a decline in the economy and the nation entangled in two seemingly interminable wars. The past 4 years have seen a clear sign of GoP obstruction to getting anything done in Congress and now they have been rewarded for it. In their own words they laid out a plan to work with the Democrats... and now this behavior is rewarded. Brilliant, isn't it?

It's not that I don't like the result or not - I would be in favor of voting out whichever party did a bad job. The point is that the data clearly show where the problems are and yet we repeat our mistakes. I guess for a nation where 32% of people consider evolution to be a reasonable theory, this is not surprising....
Did you say the same thing about Republican defeats in 2006, 2008, and 2012?
Are you saying the public education system should start turning children into good little Democrats?  They are already trying, and like everything else not doing a very good job.

Gah. What a night. Okay, listen up, Democrats! We need to spend the next two years making sure the Republicans get lots of publicity for every healthcare-stealing, national-park-pillaging, coal-hugging, climate-frying, wealth-coddling, groundwater-poisoning fracking, election-buying thing they do. Americans need to have their noses rubbed in the painful, grisly details of just what it does to our lives and our country when the Republicans win control and get their way.
